intro: Porpax atrorubra, commonly known as the red-black lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its dark, crust-like thallus that ranges in color from reddish-brown to black. This lichen typically grows on rock surfaces, especially in humid and shaded environments. Its morphology includes a medulla composed of loosely aggregated hyphae and a cortex that is tightly packed. Porpax atrorubra is often found in temperate regions and is used as an indicator species for environmental health.
